definitions: relating to Ireland, its people, or their Celtic language
characteristic of the cultural traditions, customs, or heritage of Ireland
examples: She spoke with a charming Irish accent
The Irish countryside is breathtakingly beautiful
Irish music filled the pub that evening
We enjoyed traditional Irish dancing at the festival

definitions: of or relating to the religion of Islam or its teachings
conforming to or characterized by the principles and practices of Islamic faith
examples: The Islamic calendar begins with the Hijra
Islamic art features beautiful geometric patterns
The bank offers Islamic financing options
They follow strict Islamic dietary laws

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the Ismaili branch of Shia Islam
examples: The Ismaili community celebrates important religious festivals
Ismaili Muslims follow the Aga Khan as their spiritual leader

definitions: relating to the modern state of Israel or its people
concerning the political or governmental affairs of the state of Israel
examples: The Israeli desert blooms with irrigation technology
Israeli citizens come from diverse backgrounds
Israeli policy on settlements remains controversial
The Israeli government announced new economic measures

definitions: relating to Italy, its people, or their Romance language
characteristic of Italian culture, cuisine, fashion, or artistic traditions
examples: She studied Italian literature at university
The Italian coastline attracts millions of tourists
We enjoyed authentic Italian cuisine last night
His Italian leather shoes were exceptionally well-made

definitions: of letters or type sloping to the right as in handwritten cursive
examples: Please write foreign words in italic font
The italic text emphasizes important terms

definitions: occurring frequently or in great quantities, especially of something undesirable
examples: The city was rife with corruption scandals
Speculation is rife about the company's future

definitions: having spiral grooves cut inside a gun barrel to make bullets spin
examples: The rifled barrel improved shooting accuracy significantly
Modern firearms use rifled barrels for precision

definitions: equipped with sails, ropes, and other equipment on a ship or boat
arranged dishonestly to produce an unfair or predetermined outcome
examples: The fully rigged sailing ship left the harbor
The square rigged vessel caught the wind perfectly
The election was clearly rigged against opposition parties
They discovered the game was rigged from the start

definitions: acting in accordance with moral principles and showing virtue and integrity
arising from or characterized by an outraged sense of justice or morality
examples: She lived a righteous life helping others
The righteous person acts with integrity always
His righteous anger at injustice inspired others
They felt righteous indignation about the scandal

definitions: having a legitimate or legally established claim to something
examples: The rightful owner finally reclaimed the property
She took her rightful place as company president

definitions: supporting or relating to conservative or right-wing political views and policies
examples: The rightist party won the recent election
Rightist politicians opposed the progressive reforms

definitions: situated at or extending to the position furthest to the right
examples: Click the rightmost button to save changes
The rightmost column shows the total amounts

definitions: unable to bend or be forced out of shape; not flexible
incapable of or resistant to change; strictly maintained without variation
examples: The rigid metal frame supported the structure
Her body became rigid with fear
The school enforces rigid discipline rules
His rigid thinking prevented creative solutions

definitions: extremely thorough and careful with attention to accuracy and detail
demanding strict attention to rules, procedures, or standards of quality
examples: The research underwent rigorous scientific testing
She conducted a rigorous analysis of the data
The athletes endured rigorous training sessions daily
Medical school requires rigorous academic preparation

definitions: having or characterized by a border or edge around something
examples: She wore gold rimmed glasses every day
The rimmed plates had decorative golden edges

definitions: marked with or having rings or circular bands of color
surrounded or encircled by something forming a ring shape
examples: The ringed planet Saturn is easily recognizable
A ringed dove perched on the fence
The ancient tree was ringed with protective fencing
Police ringed the building during the operation

definitions: characterized by wild and uncontrolled behavior often involving public disorder
wildly amusing and entertaining in an unrestrained and lively way
examples: The riotous crowd destroyed property downtown
Riotous behavior led to multiple arrests
The comedy show was absolutely riotous entertainment
They had a riotous time at the party

definitions: of fruit or crops fully developed and ready to be harvested or eaten
having reached the right moment for something to happen or be done
examples: The ripe tomatoes were perfect for sauce
These ripe peaches smell wonderfully sweet
The time is ripe for political change
The market was ripe for innovation

definitions: having been brought to full development or maturity through natural processes
examples: The ripened cheese had complex flavors
Sun ripened tomatoes taste incredibly sweet

definitions: torn or pulled apart forcefully leaving jagged edges or holes
having extremely well-defined muscles from intensive physical training
examples: His ripped jeans were fashionably distressed
The ripped paper couldn't be repaired
The athlete's ripped physique impressed everyone
He got completely ripped after months of training

definitions: causing something to tear or be pulled apart with force
exceptionally good, exciting, or enjoyable in British informal usage
examples: The ripping sound startled everyone nearby
Strong ripping winds damaged the tent
They had a ripping good time together
What a ripping yarn that was!

definitions: having moved from a lower position to a higher one
examples: The risen sun illuminated the mountains
Risen water levels threatened coastal communities

definitions: moving from a lower position to a higher position
increasing in amount, number, intensity, or importance over time
examples: The rising smoke signaled their location
Rising mist covered the valley floor
Rising costs concern many businesses today
Her rising influence shaped company policy

definitions: involving the possibility of danger, failure, or loss
examples: Starting a business is always risky
That risky investment could lose everything

definitions: slightly indecent or liable to shock, especially by being sexually suggestive
examples: Her risque jokes made some guests uncomfortable
The comedian's risque humor pushed boundaries

definitions: relating to or done as a religious or solemn ceremony or rite
examples: The ritual cleansing preceded the ceremony
They performed ritual dances at the festival

definitions: relating to or characteristic of rituals or religious ceremonies
done according to a rigidly followed routine lacking spontaneity
examples: The tribe's ritualistic ceremonies lasted for days
Ritualistic chanting filled the temple
His ritualistic morning routine never varied
She followed ritualistic patterns of behavior

definitions: competing for the same objective or for superiority in the same field
examples: The rival companies fought for market share
Rival teams competed fiercely for the championship

definitions: completely engrossing and holding one's attention through being fascinating
examples: The documentary provided riveting entertainment throughout
Her riveting performance captivated the entire audience

definitions: having no roads or being inaccessible by road vehicle
examples: The roadless wilderness remains completely untouched
They explored roadless areas on foot

definitions: of an animal having a coat color with a mixture of white and colored hairs
examples: The beautiful roan horse won first prize
Her roan mare had distinctive coloring

definitions: making or characterized by a loud, deep, prolonged sound
complete and unqualified in success or intensity
examples: The roaring lion frightened the visitors
Roaring waves crashed against the rocks
The business was a roaring success
They did roaring trade during the holidays

definitions: of food cooked by prolonged exposure to heat in an oven or over fire
examples: The roast chicken smelled delicious
We ordered roast beef for Sunday dinner

definitions: having been cooked by dry heat in an oven or over direct heat
examples: The roasted vegetables were perfectly caramelized
Freshly roasted coffee beans smell amazing

definitions: dressed in robes or long, loose outer garments
examples: The robed figures entered the courtroom silently
Robed monks walked through the monastery

definitions: relating to or characteristic of robots or robotics technology
mechanical and lacking normal human warmth, emotion, or spontaneity
examples: The factory uses robotic assembly lines
Robotic surgery offers greater precision
His robotic responses lacked genuine emotion
She moved with robotic precision

definitions: strong and healthy with a vigorous and sturdy constitution
able to withstand or overcome adverse conditions with strength and resilience
examples: The robust athlete completed the marathon easily
She maintained robust health into old age
The system needs robust security measures
Their robust economy weathered the crisis

definitions: consisting of, containing, or covered with rocks or stones
characterized by difficulties, obstacles, or an unsteady quality
examples: The rocky coastline was breathtakingly beautiful
They climbed the rocky mountain trail
Their marriage went through rocky periods
The company faced a rocky financial quarter

definitions: of the elaborate ornamental late baroque style of decoration prevalent in 18th-century Europe
examples: The rococo palace featured elaborate gold decoration
Rococo furniture filled the antique shop

definitions: formed into a cylindrical or spherical shape by turning over
made flat or smooth by being passed over with a rolling tool
examples: She ate rolled oats for breakfast
The rolled newspaper fit through the slot
The baker used rolled dough for pie
Rolled steel sheets were stacked nearby

definitions: exuberantly lively and amusing with boisterous good humor
examples: The rollicking party lasted until dawn
They enjoyed a rollicking adventure story

definitions: moving forward by turning over and over on an axis
having gentle rises and falls like waves in appearance
examples: The rolling ball gathered speed downhill
Rolling wheels need proper maintenance
The rolling hills stretched for miles
Rolling meadows surrounded the farmhouse

definitions: conducive to or characterized by expressions of love or romance
characterized by idealistic or unrealistic attitudes ignoring practical considerations
examples: They enjoyed a romantic dinner together
The romantic atmosphere was perfect for proposals
His romantic notions about war changed quickly
She had romantic ideas about living abroad

definitions: covered with a roof structure providing shelter from weather
examples: The newly roofed building protected valuable equipment
A roofed walkway connected the buildings

definitions: having no roof or having lost its roof structure
examples: The roofless ruins stood against the sky
Storm damage left many buildings roofless

definitions: firmly established and difficult to change or remove
having developed roots that anchor a plant in soil
examples: Her beliefs were deeply rooted in tradition
The rooted prejudice was hard to overcome
The firmly rooted tree survived the storm
Well rooted plants grow more vigorously

definitions: of a warm pink color like that of rose flowers
examples: She wore a beautiful rose dress
The rose tinted glasses changed her perspective

definitions: colored like a pink or red rose, especially showing health
promising or suggesting good fortune and happiness; unrealistically optimistic
examples: Her rosy cheeks showed good health
The rosy dawn lit up the sky
He painted a rosy picture of their future
Their rosy outlook ignored serious problems

definitions: moving in a circle around a central point or axis
examples: The rotary engine design improved efficiency
A rotary phone sat on the desk
